verses.verse: This is how a person must consider us: as rowers of the Anointed King and managers of God's secrets,
but a thing that for the rest of the time is looked for among the managers is that someone would be found who is trustable.
With me, is it for a smallest thing that I might be investigated by you or by a human judgment day? But I don't even investigate myself
(you see, I have come to realize nothing by myself, but in this I haven't been made right). The One who investigates me is the Master.

In such a way, don't judge anything before the appointed time until the Master comes, who also will illuminate the hidden things of the darkness and show the intentions of the hearts. And at that time, the high praise will happen to each person out from God.

But these things, brothers, I refashion into myself and Apollos because of you, so that in us you might learn the "not to focus above what has been written" thing, so that not one of you may be conceited on behalf of the one person, against the different person.
You see, who is considering you to be wrong? What do you have that you didn't receive? If you also received it, why do you brag as someone who didn't receive it?
Are you people who have already been stuffed? Were you already rich? Were you kings without us? And I would definitely like it if you were kings so that we also might be kings together with you.
You see, it seems to me that God showed us off last, the missionaries, as people doomed to death because we became a spectacle to the world, both to angels and to people.
We are foolish because of the Anointed King, but you all are focused in the Anointed King. We are weak, but you all are strong. You all are magnificent, but we are worthless.
Till the hour now, we even are hungry, thirsty, naked, slugged, and homeless.
And we labor, working with our own hands. As we are put down, we confer prosperity. As we are persecuted, we tolerate it.
As hurtful things are said about us, we encourage. As the world's grime, we became what is scrapped off of everything until now.
I am writing these things, not embarrassing you, but as my loved children, I am cautioning you.
You see, if you may have ten thousand nannies in the Anointed King, still you do not have many fathers; for in the Anointed King Jesus through the good news, I gave birth to you.
So I encourage you, become imitators of me.

Because of this, I sent you Timothy, who is my loved and trusted child in the Master, who will remind you again of my ways, the ones in the Anointed King, just as I teach everywhere in every assembly.
As if I am a person not coming to you, some were conceited.
But I will come to you soon, if the Master wants me to, and I will know, not the message of the people who have been conceited, but the ability.
You see, the empire of God is not in a message, but in ability.
What do you want? Should I come to you with a staff or with love and a spirit of humility?
